alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 4:09PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central Arizona and west central Arizona, including the following counties, in north central Arizona, Coconino. In west central Arizona, Yavapai. This includes the southern portions of the Rafael Burn Scar. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 405 PM MST, Doppler radar the heavier rainfall has moved out of the advised area. However, minor flooding is expected to continue in the advisory area as water runs off. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Verde River, Sycamore Creek, JD Dam Wash, Spring Creek, Coffee Creek, Railroad Draw and Tule Tank Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Coconino and Yavapai Counties - This includes the following swimming holes... Parsons Spring. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event. Avoid recently burned areas and downstream locations. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes will occur. Rockslides and mudslides will likely occur in steep terrain.
